title: A Little Maid of Province Town
creator: Alice Turner Curtis
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of A Little Maid of Province Town, by Alice Turner Curtis. Read by Arielle Lipshaw. Plucky eight year old Anne Nelson, living in Provincetown on the tip of Cape Cod, is determined to bring the Revolutionary War to an end so that she can be reunited with her soldier father. Will she succeed in carrying an important message from Boston to Newburyport, warning the American troops to be prepared, or will she be caught by the English ships patrolling the harbor? (Summary by wildemoose) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: ibrivox; literature; audiobook; alice turner curtis; massachusetts

reviews.reviewbody: Thee are quite a few heartwarming stories about plucky little girls who are adopted and end up changing their community. There is a fine line between sweet and overly sappy. The best of these stories walk this line while not making the reader feel in need of a shot of insulin. Anyway, this one is sweet and heartwarming set against the backdrop of The American Revolution. The reader is outstanding.
reviews.reviewtitle: A Sweet Story About a Brave Little Girl

reviews.reviewbody: This is a sweet little story about a very plucky little girl.  It is extremely well read and very entertaining.  Every now and then a good children's story helps to break up the dreariness of every day life and this story will make you smile.
This is my favorite reading of Arielle Lipshaw's--so far. She just keeps getting better and better!
Very charming book delightfully read by Arielle Lipshaw.
